Elon Musk

[Elon Musk](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/elon-musk), one of the richest people in the world and the man behind Tesla, SpaceX, and a flurry of world-changing ideas, seems unstoppable— a self-made billionaire thriving on 80-90 hour workweeks and big dreams. Yet beneath the surface of being a famous personality, lies a deeply human truth he shared in a raw 2017 Rolling Stone interview: "If I’m not in love, if I’m not with a long-term companion, I cannot be happy." Amid a painful breakup with [Amber Heard](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/topic/amber-heard) back then, Musk admitted the Tesla Model 3 launch (during the same time) nearly broke him. "It took every ounce of will... I was morbid," he had confessed in the interview, chugging Red Bulls and psyching up for the cameras. It's a reminder: Even visionaries need love to fuel their fire.
